intro: Anarthrosyne abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian starflower, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, blue or violet petals. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Anarthrosyne abyssinica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
